li.a: In the Event of an Emergency

li.class: mega-menu-item mega-menu-item-type-custom mega-menu-item-object-custom mega-align-bottom-left mega-menu-flyout mega-menu-item-3870

p.a: Grading Adjustments During Covid-19 | Ajustes de calificación por COVID-19

hr.p: 4-14-20: Schools Will Remain Closed the Remainder of the School Year | Las escuelas permanecerán cerradas el resto del año escolar
4-2-20: Letter from Superintendent | Carta de la superintendente
4-1-20: Free Grab & Go Meals Available During Spring Recess | Desayuno y almuerzo gratis disponibles durante el recreo de primavera
3-31-20: Internet Safety Tips from Summit County Sheriff | Consejos de seguridad en Internet del Sheriff del condado de Summit
3-30-20: Governor Herbert’s Stay Safe, Stay Home Directive
3-28-20: At-Home Learning Resources | Recursos de aprendizaje en el hogar
3-26-20: Summit County Stay-at-Home Health Order
3-25-20: Addressing students’ emotional needs during school dismissal | Abordar las necesidades emocionales de los estudiantes durante la suspensión de la escuela
3-23-20: Letter to Parents (Governor extends school dismissals to May 1) | Carta a los Padres ( Escuelas cerradas hasta el 1 de mayo)
3-19-20: Letter to Parents (staff telecommuting) | Carta a los Padres (empleado teletrabajo)
3-18-20: Summit County COVID-19 Frequently Asked Questions | Condado de Summit COVID-19 Preguntas frecuentes
3-17-20: The swimming pool at Ecker Hill Middle School is closed through May 1. | La piscina de Ecker Hill Middle School está cerrada hasta el 1 de mayo.
3-16-20: At-Home Learning Resources | Recursos de aprendizaje en el hogar
3-15-20: Grab & Go Student Breakfast/Lunch Information | Información de desayuno / almuerzo para estudiantes Grab & Go
3-13-20: Schools Dismissed for 2 Weeks Starting Monday, March 16 | Escuelas cerradas por 2 semanas a partir del lunes 16 de marzo
3-12-20: A message from Dr. Gildea | Un mensaje del Dr. Gildea

3-11-20: All Park City schools are open. In the event of school closures, you will receive communications from the district and school status will be posted here on the homepage. Preemptive closure due to COVID-19 is not recommended at this time by Summit County Health Department. On Friday, March 13, we will be sending instructions to all parents on continued learning in the event of a potential closure. Reminder: there will be no classes Monday, March 16, due to a scheduled teacher professional learning day.

p.span: Todas las escuelas de Park City están abiertas. En caso de cierre de la escuela, recibirá comunicaciones del distrito y el estado de la escuela se publicará aquí en la página de inicio. En este momento, el Departamento de Salud del Condado de Summit no recomienda el cierre preventivo debido a COVID-19. El viernes 13 de marzo, enviaremos instrucciones a todos los padres sobre el aprendizaje continuo en caso de un posible cierre. Recordatorio: no habrá clases el lunes 16 de marzo, debido a un día de aprendizaje profesional docente programado.

hr.p: 3-10-20: Park City School District is working closely with Summit County health officials and will follow their expert recommendations to best ensure the safety of everyone in our school community. Of course learning at school primarily occurs inside classrooms with face-to-face teaching by certified educators using interactive technology tools.
Be assured we are currently doing the following:
– Working proactively to clean all high-touch surfaces nightly.
– Promoting safe hygiene methods with students, staff, and community.
– Actively monitoring illness statistics across the district.
– Examining student and staff travel for continuation.
– Preparing educational mission for at-home, electronic, and paper delivery.
– Preparing staff for optimal operations in the event of a closure.
– Preparing for post incident recovery of schools in the event of a closure.

COVID-19 is spread very similar to the flu and common colds. For this reason, we are encouraging our students and staff to actively wash their hands and take all of the same precautions they would normally take to avoid these illnesses. Please encourage your children to do the same at home as they build healthy habits.

p.span: El Distrito Escolar de Park City está trabajando en estrecha colaboración con los funcionarios de salud del Condado de Summit y seguirá sus recomendaciones expertas para garantizar la seguridad de todos en nuestra comunidad escolar. Por supuesto, el aprendizaje en nuestra escuela ocurre principalmente dentro de las aulas con enseñanza presencial por parte de instructores certificados que utilizan herramientas tecnológicas interactivas.
Tenga la seguridad de que actualmente estamos haciendo lo siguiente:
– Trabajando proactivamente para limpiar todas las superficies de alto contacto todas las noches.
– Promoviendo métodos de higiene seguros con estudiantes, personal y comunidad.
– Monitoreando activamente las estadísticas de enfermedades en todo el distrito.
– Examinando los viajes de estudiantes y personal.
– Preparando la misión educativa para ser distribuida en el hogar, electrónicamente y en papel.
– Preparando al personal para operaciones óptimas en caso de cierre.
– Preparándonos para la recuperación de las escuelas después del incidente en caso de cierre.

COVID-19 se propaga de manera muy similar a la gripe y los resfriados comunes. Por esta razón, alentamos a nuestros estudiantes y al personal a que se laven las manos activamente y tomen las mismas precauciones que normalmente tomarían para evitar estas enfermedades. Anime a sus hijos a hacer lo mismo en casa mientras desarrollan hábitos saludables.

hr.p: 2-28-20: PCSD Letter to the Community |Carta de PCSD a la Comunidad
What You Need to Know About COVID-19 (English & Spanish)

p.a: Center for Disease Control and Prevention

div.class: vc_separator wpb_content_element vc_separator_align_center vc_sep_width_100 vc_sep_pos_align_center vc_separator_no_text

div.h1: Park City High Ranked One of Utah's Best High Schools

p.span: U.S. News and World Report’s 2020 Best High School report ranks
Park City High 19th among Utah’s
429 high schools
The rankings are based on college readiness, college curriculum breadth, math and reading proficiency and performance, underserved student performance,
and graduate rate. To determine the 2020
, U.S. News reviewed more than 24,100 public high schools across the country.

div.class: vc_separator wpb_content_element vc_separator_align_center vc_sep_width_100 vc_sep_pos_align_center vc_separator_no_text

div.h1: Public Input on 2020-21 Student Fees & Policies

p.span: The Board of Education held the first of two public meetings Feb. 25 to discuss school fees for the 2020-21 school year. A second meeting is

yet to be scheduled (due to COVID-19). Proposed school fee policies and estimated school fees are posted below. You are invited to offer public comment regarding the proposed policies and fee schedules.

hr.p: Policy 10125: Student Fee Waivers – Revised
Policy 11020: Fund Raising – Revised
New Policy: Student Fees – Draft
2020-21 Fee Schedule – Draft

div.class: vc_separator wpb_content_element vc_separator_align_center vc_sep_width_100 vc_sep_pos_align_center vc_separator_no_text

div.p: Park City School District is one of the best districts in the country for good reason. From academics to athletics, our students are recognized for their outstanding achievements. Each month the district presents its accolades to the Board of Education prior to its regular meeting. Click below to view our honors and achievements so far this school year.
